meanings.definition: To hold over or beyond a certain time or limit.
meanings.sent1: I will overhold the book until you return next week.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overhold her guests, making sure they feel welcome.
meanings.sent3: The teacher decided to overhold the students for a few extra minutes as a surprise.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was like an overhold, stretching beyond what anyone expected.
meanings.sent5: The suspense in the movie was overhold until the very end.

meanings.sent1: He tends to overhold his childhood toys, unable to let them go.
meanings.sent2: The company will overhold the property until the legal matters are resolved.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly threatened to overhold his favorite snack until he finished his chores.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day overhold a special place in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The antique shop owner tends to overhold unique items for his collection.

meanings.sent1: She will overhold the family heirloom for generations to come.
meanings.sent2: The museum decided to overhold the ancient artifact for further study.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally overheld his friend's pen and returned it the next day.
meanings.sent4: The secret overheld by the old diary was finally revealed.
meanings.sent5: The treasure hunter was determined to overhold the lost map until he found the hidden chest.
